meanings.sent1: Her lucidness in explaining complex ideas made the topic easy to grasp.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lucidness in lectures helped students understand difficult concepts.
meanings.sent3: His lucidness in describing the messy situation brought a sense of order to chaos.
meanings.sent4: The author's lucidness in storytelling painted vivid pictures in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The clarity and lucidness of her speech left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: The quality of being easily understood or comprehended
meanings.sent1: The lucidness of the instructions made assembling the furniture a breeze.
meanings.sent2: The lucidness of the map helped travelers navigate the city without confusion.
meanings.sent3: The lucidness of the recipe made even a novice cook feel like a chef.
meanings.sent4: The lucidness of his explanation was like a light shining through a foggy mind.
meanings.sent5: The lucidness of the presentation made the complex topic seem simple and approachable.
